label: A2B7C2_oP44_33_2a_7a_2a-001
title: Possible $\delta$-Gd$_{2}$Si$_{2}$O$_{7}$ Structure
comments:
(Smolin, 1970) found that some structures of RE$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$ (RE = Ho, Dy, Gd, Y) were in the orthorhombic $Pna2_{1}$ \#33 space group, in which case this would be the prototype of $\delta$-RE$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$ (Becerro, 2004). 
 Later, (Dias, 1990) found \href{current_web_home_dir/A7B2C2_oP44_62_3c2d_2c_d-001}{$\delta$-Y$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$} to be in the centro-symmetric $Pnma$ \#62 space group. 
 This was supported by (Becerro, 2004), who found only one yttrium site in the $\delta$-structure. 
 In addition, if we allow a small amount of uncertainty (0.2{\AA}) in positions, FINDSYM places this structure in the $Pnma$ group. 
 Nevertheless we have found no work explicitly stating that the structure of (Smolin, 1970) is in error, and indeed (Christensen, 1994) found $\delta$-Y$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$ in space group $Pna2_{1}$.  Given this ambiguity, we list Gd$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$ as a possible prototype for the $\delta$-phase pyrosilicates. 
 While the ICSD has entries for Eu$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$, Nd$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$, and Yb$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$ from (Smolin, 1970), there is no entry for Gd$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$, perhaps suggesting that this structure is considered unreliable.
